contextId.information: The abstract noun "kindness" can be stated as "kind." AT: "you have been very kind to me by saving my life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: you have shown me great kindness in saving my life

contextId.information: The abstract noun "death" can be stated as "die." AT: "I do not want to watch the boy die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Let me not look upon the death of the child

contextId.information: The two men had made a covenant with each other. The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be stated as "faithful" or "loyal." AT: "Be as faithful to me and to the land as I have been to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Show to me ... covenant faithfulness that I have shown to you

contextId.information: The abstract noun "witness" can be stated as "to prove." AT: "to prove to everyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: so that it may be a witness for me

contextId.information: The abstract noun "the hearing" can be stated as "hear" or "listening" AT: "so that the people who lived in the area could hear" or  "while the people who lived in the area were listening" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: in the hearing of the people of the land

contextId.information: The abstract noun "the hearing" can be stated as "hear" or "listening." AT: "so that all the sons of Heth could hear him" or  "while all the sons of Heth were listening" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: in the hearing of the sons of Heth

contextId.information: This is faithfulness because of the covenant that God made with Abraham. The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be stated as "be faithful." AT: "be faithful to my master Abraham because of your covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: show covenant faithfulness to my master Abraham

contextId.information: The abstract noun "faithfulness" can be stated as "been faithful." AT: "that you have been faithful to my master because of your covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: that you have shown covenant faithfulness to my master

contextId.information: "has not stopped showing his covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness to my master." The abstract nouns "faithfulness" and "trustworthiness" can be stated as "to be faithful and trustworthy." AT: "has continued to be faithful and trustworthy because of his covenant with my master" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: has not forsaken his covenant faithfulness and his trustworthiness toward my master

contextId.information: These abstract nouns can be stated as "faithful and trustworthy." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Leah was experiencing emotional pain because Jacob had rejected her. The abstract noun "affliction" can be stated as a verb. AT: "Yahweh saw that I was suffering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh has looked upon my affliction

contextId.information: Jacob is reminding Laban of their contract ([[:en:bible:notes:gen:29:26|Gen 29:27]]). The abstract noun "service" can be stated as "served." AT: "you know that I have served you long enough" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: you know the service I have given you

contextId.information: The abstract noun "oppression" can be stated as "oppressed." AT: "God has seen how hard I worked and how you oppressed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: God has seen my oppression and how hard I worked

contextId.information: The abstract noun "deceit" can be stated as the verb "lied." AT: "But the sons of Jacob lied to Shechem and Hamor when they answered them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with deceit

contextId.information: The abstract noun "undesirableness" can be translated with an adjective. AT: "such ugly cows" or "such worthless looking cows" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "mercy" can be stated as the adjective "kind." AT: "May God Almighty cause the man to be kind to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: May God Almighty give you mercy before the man

contextId.information: The abstract noun "Peace" can be stated as a verb. AT: "Relax" (UDB) or "Calm yourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "deliverance" can be stated as "rescuing." AT: "to keep you alive by rescuing you in a mighty way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: to keep you alive by a great deliverance

contextId.information: The abstract noun "abomination" can be translated with the adjective "disgusting." AT: "Egyptians think shepherds are disgusting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: every shepherd is an abomination to the Egyptians
